New Records: Virat Kohli is now one short of compatriot Sachin Tendulkar's world record of 49 ODI hundreds
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored his 48th ODI hundred to help India beat Bangladesh by seven wickets
Kohli finished with 103 not out off 97 balls
Kohli and Rahul added an unbeaten 83 runs off 74 balls for the fourth wicket
Kuldeep Yadav trapped Tanzid Hasan lbw in the 15th over
Ravindra Jadeja trapped stand-in skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto lbw for eight runs
Jadeja dismissed Litton Das, who scored 66 off 82 balls with seven fours
Mehidy Hasan Miraz was surprisingly promoted but wicketkeeper Rahul took a diving catch to his left and sent him back for three runs
Mahmudullah top-scored with 46 off 36 balls and hit three fours and three sixes
Post-Match Reflections: Kohli said it's a'special feeling' to play the tournament in India
The MCA Stadium was at full capacity with 33,610 fans
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh opted to bat first but got off to a great start on a batting-friendly surface
Tanzid Hasan scored a maiden ODI half-century
India's all-rounder Hardik Pandya hobbled off in the ninth over with a twisted left ankle
Pandya did not bowl or field for the remainder of the game
